channel.title: kinisis DSS newsfeed
channel.description: RSS newsfeed for the 'kinisis DSS' platform

item.title: Pre-release of several 'kinisis DSS' Dashboards (IV)
item.author: schristo@ucy.ac.cy
item.description: Traffic data is sourced from the Ministry of Transport's Diavlos platform and from UAVs; transport condition data is crowd-sourced from custom-made low-cost vibration and image sensors; while air-quality and metereology data is sourced from Cyprus' open-data portal.

item.title: Pre-release of several 'kinisis DSS' Dashboards (III)
item.author: schristo@ucy.ac.cy
item.description: The Air-Quality Dashboard gathers, in 60-minute intervals, air-quality data from several national sources and presents it in spatiotemporal graphs, by location and pollutant.

item.title: Pre-release of several 'kinisis DSS' Dashboards (II)
item.author: schristo@ucy.ac.cy
item.description: The Metereology Dashboard gathers, in 10-minute intervals, metereological data from several national sources and presents it in spatiotemporal graphs, by location and metereological KPI.

item.title: Pre-release of several 'kinisis DSS' Dashboards (I)
item.author: schristo@ucy.ac.cy
item.description: UCY's Construction & Transport Infrastructure Management Division announces the pre-release of a decision support system (DSS), a webGIS & a number of dashboards on traffic & transport infrastructure assessment, air-quality & metereology monitoring, for Cyprus. The work, partially funded by the Cyprus Research and Innovation Foundation and Interreg Greece-Cyprus is partnered with UCY, the KIOS CoE, the Cyprus Ministry of Transport, Communications and Works, Signalgenerix, Geoimagin and the Lakatamia Municipality.

item.title: RONDA architecture schematic issued
item.description: 'RONDA' issues a schematic of the system's proposed architecture. Technical specifications and data flows will be released by the end of April 2020.

item.title: The RONDA project kicks off
item.description: 'RONDA' kicks off, with an inagaural consortium meeting at the University of Cyprus. Several outstanding pieces of the 'RONDA' puzzle have been put into place and the consortium is ready to proceed.
